name: prepayment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an arrangement in which a service or product is paid for, or partly paid for, before it is used or obtained, or the amount that is paid: They moved into a home with a prepayment meter for electricity. A pre-payment of £50 as part of the rental cost is required.
finance & economics
  specialized the act of paying a debt before it is due to be paid, or the amount that is paid : There is no penalty or fee for prepayment of a loan. Most contracts allow pre-payments of 10 to 20 percent of the balance each year without penalty. Synonym
prepay
More examplesFewer examplesSome petrol stations require prepayment.People who have difficulty in paying for their water may prefer to have prepayment meters fitted.Prepayments can erode returns if the investor is unable to quickly lend the money again at a similar rate.Lenders charge prepayment penalties if you sell your home or refinance the mortgage before a specified time.
